title: Strategic IT-Planning
ziele: Students will learn to assess the strategic potential of information and communication technologies and their relevance in attaining organizational goals. Students will learn more about key tasks in strategic IT planning and will be in a position to implement the corresponding and appropriate methods and tools.
lehrinhalte: Networked organizations and goods & services; IT and organizational strategy; IT supported business models; IT key data and controlling; managing IT infrastructures; IT outsourcing; frameworks, standards and compliance of IT applications.
beurteilung: Examination (50%), homework assignments and in-class participation (50%)
literatur:
Reading:

  • Andriof, J.; Waddock, S.; Husted B.; Sutherland Rahmann, S.: Unfolding Stakeholder Thinking. Greenleaf Publishing, Sheffield, 2003. (selected chapters)
  • Heinrich, L. J.; Stelzer, D.: Informationsmanagement: Grundlagen, Aufgaben, Methoden. Oldenbourg, Munich/Vienna, in the current edition.
  • Laudon, K.,C.; Laudon, J. P.; Schoder, D.: Wirtschaftsinformatik. Pearson, 2010. (selected chapters)

Supplementary literature will be provided during the semester.
